seriesJson.title: Business review
seriesJson.description: This series, hosted by Ross Wilhelm, focuses on current news stories that relate to business and economic activity.

node.title: Protecting investors
node.description: In program number 395, Ross Wilhelm talks about protecting the investing public.

node.title: Nixon's approach to inflation
node.description: In program number 407, Ross Wilhelm discusses the Nixon administration's approach to dealing with inflation.

node.title: Balance of payments crisis
node.description: In program number 411, Ross Wilhelm revisits the issues of balance of payments deficits.

node.title: Travel time to airports
node.description: In program number 391, Ross Wilhelm talks about the issue of excessive time spent travelling between urban areas and airports.

node.title: Economic growth
node.description: In program number 416, Ross Wilhelm talks about methods of maintaining economic growth.

node.title: New business formations
node.description: In program number 410, Ross Wilhelm talks about the levels of new business formations and mergers.

node.title: Pressure on the dollar
node.description: In program number 400, Ross Wilhelm talks about pressure on the American dollar.

node.title: Wage price guideposts
node.description: In program number 398, Ross Wilhelm talks about wage price guideposts in the United States.

node.title: Conglomerate firms
node.description: In program number 412, Ross Wilhelm talks about the rise of conglomerate firms.

node.title: Leisure time crisis
node.description: In program number 419, Ross Wilhelm talks about the concept of a "leisure time crisis," related to work and free time.

node.title: Savings bonds
node.description: In program number 405, Ross Wilhelm criticizes the current system that the American government uses to sell savings bonds.

node.title: Retail cooperatives
node.description: In program number 413, Ross Wilhelm discusses retail cooperatives and why they haven't succeeded in the United States as they have elsewhere in the world.

node.title: Antitrust laws
node.description: In program number 415, Ross Wilhelm discusses recent developments with antitrust laws.

node.title: International monetary policies
node.description: In program number 392, Ross Wilhelm talks about the issue of international monetary policies.

node.title: DLJ goes public
node.description: In program number 420, Ross Wilhelm talks about the decision that a brokerage firm on Wall Street made to go public.

node.title: Fixed exchange rates
node.description: In program number 406, Ross Wilhelm talks about fixed exchange rates and their role in the troubled international monetary system.

node.title: Nixon's style of operations
node.description: In program number 404, Ross Wilhelm talks about President Richard Nixon's style of operation during his first few months in office.

node.title: Suez Canal
node.description: In program number 408,  Ross Wilhelm talks about the Suez Canal and its business aspects.

node.title: Oil in Alaska
node.description: In program number 399, Ross Wilhelm talks about the discovery of oil in Alaska and its financial repercussions.

node.title: Balance of payments deficits
node.description: In program number 396, Ross Wilhelm talks about the United States' problems with a balance of payments deficit.

node.title: Water issues
node.description: In program number 393, Ross Wilhelm talks about the issue of too much water as a problem in agriculture.

node.title: Government finance difficulties
node.description: In program number 397, Ross Wilhelm talks about the financial difficulties that local and state governments have had, although they might be beneficial longterm.

node.title: Steel
node.description: In program number 409, Ross Wilhelm talks about the steel industry.

node.title: Voluntary army
node.description: In program number 401, Ross Wilhelm asserts that the draft should be eliminated and a voluntary army should be in place. He explores arguments on both sides.

node.title: Banning advertising for cigarettes
node.description: In program number 402, Ross Wilhelm talks about a possible ban on cigarette advertising.

node.title: Group theory
node.description: In program number 403, Ross Wilhelm talks about the issue of whether or not the group theory of economic progress is valid.

node.title: Currency exchange rates
node.description: In program number 414, Ross Wilhelm discusses fixed currency exchange rates.

node.title: Ireland
node.description: In program number 394, Ross Wilhelm talks about unrest in Ireland and its impact on business.

node.title: Business review #388
node.description: No information available.
